de.hshl.obj.wavefront.obj

Class TriangularOBJBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.hshl.obj.wavefront.obj.TriangularOBJBuilder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PolygonalOBJBuilder

    public class TriangularOBJBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
implements PolygonalOBJBuilder
    An PolygonalOBJBuilder object that can be built from an OBJ file using a Parser<PolygonalOBJBuilder>. If anything goes wrong, a DecodingException will be thrown. This includes any IO Errors that occur while loading an externally linked MTL file (but excludes IO Errors of the OBJ file), too many or not enough vector dimensions, or internal errors.

    This Builder can handle geometry with non-triangular polygons, however loading an OBJ file will be faster (and the result more predicable) if it contains only triangles.

    This implementation does not track any information regarding smoothing groups, point clouds, lines, bevel, color interpolation, dissolve interpolation, shadow objects, raytracing objects, or level of detail.

    If any of these are encountered, an error message will be printed into System.err, and the rest of the line will be ignored.

    Decoding can be customized by inserting your own Parser.LineParser into the Parser, extending this class, or implementing the PolygonalOBJBuilder interface.
    Author:
    Johannes Vollmer

    • Field Detail

      • INDEX_NOT_SPECIFIED

        public static final int INDEX_NOT_SPECIFIED
        The integer which is inserted if an index was not specified inside the OBJ file. Missing indices will not throw any exception while loading the data. When converting the mesh however, all indices are required.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • face

        public void face(java.util.stream.Stream<VertexMultiIndex> polygon)
        Description copied from interface: PolygonalOBJBuilder
        An index of 0 means that it was not specified. In OBJ files, 0 is an invalid index, because indices start at 1.
        Specified by:
        face in interface PolygonalOBJBuilder
        Parameters:
        polygon - Consume this polygon and save it to the array after converting it to triangles

      • getResource

        public Resource getResource()
        The environment containing this OBJ file and any linked MTL files. Will be used to find MTL files and Textures in the same folder as the OBJ file.

      • getMaterialParser

        public Parser<MTL> getMaterialParser()
        Allow using a shared MTL Parser instance.

      • getPrintWarnings

        public boolean getPrintWarnings()
        Return whether this OBJ builder will print errors

      • isIgnoreThirdTextureCoordinate

        public boolean isIgnoreThirdTextureCoordinate()
        Return whether this OBJ builder will ignore a third texture coordinate

      • getTriangulator

        public Triangulator getTriangulator()
        Return how this OBJ builder will triangulate polygons

      • getPositions

        public FloatVectors getPositions()
        Contains all vertex positions, in interleaved [ x0,y0,z0, x1,y1,z1, ...] order.

      • getTextureCoordinates

        @Nullable
public FloatVectors getTextureCoordinates()
        Contains all texture coordinates, in interleaved [ x0,y0, x1,y1, ...] order. Is null if no texture coordinates should be loaded. Contains INDEX_NOT_SPECIFIED where no index was specified.

      • getNormals

        @Nullable
public FloatVectors getNormals()
        Contains all surface normals, in interleaved [ x0,y0,z0, x1,y1,z1, ...] order. Is null if no normals should be loaded. Contains INDEX_NOT_SPECIFIED where no index was specified.

      • getTriangles

        public IntegerVectors getTriangles()
        Contains all faces, only triangles, one after another, interleaved like
        [
           p0, t0, v0,   p1, t1, v1,   p2, t2, v2,      // first triangle
           p3, t3, v3,   p4, t4, v4,   p5, t5, v5,      // second triangle
        ].
        Contains INDEX_NOT_SPECIFIED where an index was missing. All normal indices and texture coordinate indices will also have that value if normals or texture coordinates should not be loaded.

      • getObjects

        @Nullable
public java.util.List<Indexing<java.lang.String>> getObjects()
        Stores in a list the triangle face index where each object starts. Is null if no objects should be extracted.

      • getGroups

        @Nullable
public java.util.List<Indexing<java.lang.String[]>> getGroups()
        Stores in a list the triangle face index where each group starts. Multiple groups can contain the same data. Is null if no groups should be extracted.

      • getMaterials

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,Material> getMaterials()
        Contains all Materials available to this OBJ file. Is null if no materials should be extracted.

      • getMaterialIndices

        public java.util.List<Indexing<Material>> getMaterialIndices()
        Contains indices pointing to where a Material appears in this OBJ file. Is null if no materials should be extracted.
